param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows reconising the mavlink version

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduCopter:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: ArduCopter:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_TYPE
param.documentation: Used to adjust scaling to match the sonar used (only Maxbotix sonars are supported at this time)

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GPS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls what action will be taken if GPS signal is lost for at least 5 seconds

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: ArduCopter:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduCopter:FLOW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

param.name: ArduCopter:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Enabling this turn on one of the Super Simple Mode variants. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduCopter:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_TOTAL
param.documentation: Total number of commands in the mission stored in the eeprom. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_INDEX
param.documentation: The index number of the command that is currently being executed. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:CIRCLE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

param.name: ArduCopter:CIRCLE_RATE
param.documentation: Circle mode's turn rate in degrees / second. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before begining final descent

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle that will be sent to the motors

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduCopter:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MID
param.documentation: The throttle output (0 ~ 1000) when throttle stick is in mid position. Used to scale the manual throttle so that the mid throttle stick position is close to the throttle required to hover

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduCopter:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduCopter:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 2 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduCopter:ESC
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_LOW
param.documentation: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_HIGH
param.documentation: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduCopter:CH7_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:CH8_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH8 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Allows enabling or disabling of pre-arming checks of receiver, accelerometer, barometer, compass and GPS

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_FF
param.documentation: Rate Pitch Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_FF
param.documentation: Rate Roll Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_FF
param.documentation: Rate Yaw Feed Forward (for TradHeli Only)

param.name: ArduCopter:STAB_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Helicopter's minimum collective position while pilot directly controls collective in stabilize mode

param.name: ArduCopter:STAB_COL_MAX
param.documentation: Helicopter's maximum collective position while pilot directly controls collective in stabilize mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO, Stabilize and SPORT modes. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:LED_MODE
param.documentation: bitmap to control the copter led mode

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the latitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_I
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the latitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_D
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the longitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_I
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the longitude direction

param.humanName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_D
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_P
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_I
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical speed and actual speed

param.humanName: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the desired acceleration that the I gain will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_D
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_I
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.humanName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_D
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a roll angle

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_I
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently rolling left or right

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll angle that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_D
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the roll direction

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a pitch angle

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_I
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently pitching left or right

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch angle that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_D
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the pitch direction

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired roll angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired pitch angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired yaw angle and actual angle

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum yaw rate that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_P
param.documentation: Altitude controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_I
param.documentation: Altitude controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired altitude and actual altitude

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_IMAX
param.documentation: Altitude controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum climb rate rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_I
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in latitude) to the target location

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter longitude position controller P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the longitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter longitude rate controller

param.humanName: Loiter longitude position controller I gain
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_I
param.documentation: Loiter longitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in longitude direction) to the target location

param.humanName: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_IMAX
param.documentation: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.name: HS1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: HS1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: HS2_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS2_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS2_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: HS2_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: HS3_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS3_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS3_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS3_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: HS3_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: HS4_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS4_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS4_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: HS4_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: HS4_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS2_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS3_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS3_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS4_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS4_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS4_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC2_DZ

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC3_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC3_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC4_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC4_TRIM

param.name: RC5_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC5_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC5_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC5_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC6_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC6_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC6_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC6_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC7_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC7_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC7_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC7_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC8_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC8_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC8_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC9_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC9_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC9_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC10_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC10_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC10_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC11_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC11_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC11_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: RC12_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC12_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC12_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC12_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC12_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: RC12_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for relay control.

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only).

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: INAV_TC_XY
param.documentation: Time constant for GPS and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases GPS impact on position estimate

param.name: INAV_TC_Z
param.documentation: Time constant for baro and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases barometers impact on altitude estimate

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: SR0_RAW_SENS
param.documentation: Raw sensor stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extended status stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_EXT_STAT
param.documentation: Extended status stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: RC Channel stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_RC_CHAN
param.documentation: RC Channel stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Raw Control stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_RAW_CTRL
param.documentation: Raw Control stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Position stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_POSITION
param.documentation: Position stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_EXTRA1
param.documentation: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_EXTRA2
param.documentation: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_EXTRA3
param.documentation: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Parameter stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_PARAMS
param.documentation: Parameter stream rate to ground station

param.name: SR3_RAW_SENS
param.documentation: Raw sensor stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extended status stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_EXT_STAT
param.documentation: Extended status stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: RC Channel stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_RC_CHAN
param.documentation: RC Channel stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Raw Control stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_RAW_CTRL
param.documentation: Raw Control stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Position stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_POSITION
param.documentation: Position stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_EXTRA1
param.documentation: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_EXTRA2
param.documentation: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_EXTRA3
param.documentation: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station

param.humanName: Parameter stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR3_PARAMS
param.documentation: Parameter stream rate to ground station

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_DELAY
param.documentation: number of GPS samples to delay accels for synchronisation with the GPS velocity data

param.name: MNT_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT2_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT2_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT2_CONTROL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT2_CONTROL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT2_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: SPRAYER_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

param.name: SPRAYER_PUMP_RATE
param.documentation: Desired pump speed when travelling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

param.name: SPRAYER_SPINNER
param.documentation: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

param.name: SPRAYER_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

param.name: SPRAYER_PUMP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

param.name: GND_ABS_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: GND_TEMP
param.documentation: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

param.name: GND_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: FENCE_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality

param.name: FENCE_TYPE
param.documentation: Enabled fence types held as bitmask

param.humanName: Action to perform when the limit is breached
param.name: FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on fence breach

param.name: FENCE_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: FENCE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

param.name: FENCE_MARGIN
param.documentation: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

param.name: GPSGLITCH_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) gps glitch protection

param.humanName: GPS glitch protection radius within which all new positions are accepted
param.name: GPSGLITCH_RADIUS
param.documentation: GPS glitch protection radius within which all new positions are accepted

param.humanName: GPS glitch protection's max vehicle acceleration assumption
param.name: GPSGLITCH_ACCEL
param.documentation: GPS glitch protection's max vehicle acceleration assumption

param.name: H_SV1_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #1

param.name: H_SV2_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #2

param.name: H_SV3_POS
param.documentation: Angular location of swash servo #3

param.name: H_ROL_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum roll angle of the swash plate

param.name: H_PIT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum pitch angle of the swash plate

param.name: H_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest possible servo position for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MAX
param.documentation: Highest possible servo position for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MID
param.documentation: Swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Assymetrical blades)

param.name: H_TAIL_TYPE
param.documentation: Tail type selection. Simpler yaw controller used if external gyro is selected

param.name: H_SWASH_TYPE
param.documentation: Swash Type Setting - either 3-servo CCPM or H1 Mechanical Mixing

param.name: H_GYR_GAIN
param.documentation: PWM sent to external gyro on ch7 when tail type is Servo w/ ExtGyro

param.name: H_SV_MAN
param.documentation: Pass radio inputs directly to servos for set-up. Do not set this manually!

param.name: H_PHANG
param.documentation: Phase angle correction for rotor head. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_COLYAW
param.documentation: Feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased. Can be positive or negative depending on mechanics.

param.name: H_GOV_SETPOINT
param.documentation: PWM passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled

param.name: H_RSC_MODE
param.documentation: Controls the source of the desired rotor speed, either ch8 or RSC_SETPOINT

param.name: H_FLYBAR_MODE
param.documentation: Flybar present or not. Affects attitude controller used during ACRO flight mode

param.name: H_LAND_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum collective position while landed or landing

param.name: H_RSC_RAMP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds for the output to the main rotor's ESC to reach full speed

param.name: H_RSC_RUNUP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds for the main rotor to reach full speed. Must be longer than RSC_RAMP_TIME

param.humanName: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed
param.name: H_TAIL_SPEED
param.documentation: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed. Only used when TailType is DirectDrive VarPitch

param.name: SS1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS2_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS2_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS3_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS3_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS3_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: SS4_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS4_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS4_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SS4_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: SS4_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim.

param.name: MOT_TCRV_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether a curve is used to linearize the thrust produced by the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MIDPCT
param.documentation: Set the pwm position that produces half the maximum thrust of the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MAXPCT
param.documentation: Set to the lowest pwm position that produces the maximum thrust of the motors. Most motors produce maximum thrust below the maximum pwm value that they accept.

param.name: MOT_SPIN_ARMED
param.documentation: Controls whether motors always spin when armed (must be below THR_MIN)

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.
